text:
="preserve">Oleg Evgenievich Osetinsky (9 July 1937 – 27 September 2020) was a Soviet-Russian screenwriter and documentary movie director. He was born in Yekaterinburg, Russia. His career began in 1961. He was best known for writing the screenplay for "The Captivating Star of Happiness" and "Takeoff".
Osetinsky died on 27 September 2020 in Moscow, aged 83.
